ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Connect time?
ygData.msgSnippet: Maybe they re going thru a growth spurt.  Having too many people logging in and whatnot.  I also noticed last night that when a server goes down, the newbie
ygData.messageBody:
Maybe they're going thru a growth spurt. Having too many people logging in
and whatnot. I also noticed last night that when a server goes down, the
newbie count goes WAY up as people switch over to another server for a bit
just so they can keep playing. On PVP, that means a LOT of resources taken
up for the corpse count at the newbie entrance. At least outside of Qeynos
it was that way, must've been over 30 bodies laying on the ground outside
of the entrance to Qeynos.




LeSamLam@... on 04/20/2001 08:54:42 AM

Please respond to EverQuest@yahoogroups.com

To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
cc:
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Connect time?


My husband and I kept going LD last night and that's what it was doing when
we tried to sign back on.  Computer #1 is P2-350 256 meg ram, Windows ME,
40
gig HD, 8x burner.  Computer #2 is Celeron 533, 192 meg ram, 10 gig HD,
Windows ME.  Both are on cable modem using ICS.  We finally gave up because
of the lag and linkdead problems and then trying to get signed back into
game.



Is it just me, or is it taking longer and longer to connect?  I couldn't
even get past the login screen for 5 or 10 minutes.  Kept saying that it
couldn't connect to login server.  Never had that happen unless it was down
for a patch (which it wasn't).  Also noticed that the times when I choose
my server, and going to the character screen, and the time from the
character screen to the game are much longer.

I'm running a Celeron 533 w/ 185 MB ram, windows ME a cable modem, and
about 2GB of drive space for windows to write to.  Any suggestions?
